html:
Fear ye not, neither be afraid. The Lord instructs Israel not to fear the idols and graven images, which are identified in Isa. 44:9-20. Then the Lord asks, "Is there a God beside me? yea, there is no God; I know not any" (44:8), implying that Israel must fear God and none other.

witnesses. The people of Israel are again reminded of their calling as the Lord's witnesses.

Rock. Christ, or Jehovah, is the Rock, representing permanence, stability, and eternality (see commentary on 2:21; 8:14).
